flaw_data.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
flaw_data.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

flaw_data.plain_language: Your wrist snap needs improvement. Snap your wrist down aggressively for better backspin and soft touch.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Snap your wrist down aggressively after release. Your fingers should point to the floor.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Bed shooting: Lie on your back and shoot straight up, focusing on aggressive wrist snap.

detailed_flaws.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

detailed_flaws.description: Shot timing could be more efficient for better rhythm
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shot timing could be more efficient. Work on smooth rhythm from catch to release.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Focus on smooth rhythm from catch to release. Don't rush - let the shot flow naturally.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Metronome shooting: Practice with consistent rhythm - catch, dip, and shoot with even timing.

detailed_flaws.description: Guide hand positioned underneath ball instead of on side
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your guide hand is too far under the ball. Keep it on the side for proper support without interference.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Position your guide hand on the side of the ball, not underneath. Think "passenger, not driver."
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Tennis ball drill: Hold a tennis ball with your guide hand on the side while shooting with the other.

detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your wrist snap needs improvement. Snap your wrist down aggressively for better backspin and soft touch.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Snap your wrist down aggressively after release. Your fingers should point to the floor.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Bed shooting: Lie on your back and shoot straight up, focusing on aggressive wrist snap.

detailed_flaws.description: Advanced analysis detected jerky or rushed shooting motion lacking smooth rhythm
detailed_flaws.remedy_tip: Focus on smooth, rhythmic motion from start to finish. Practice shooting in slow motion to develop muscle memory.
detailed_flaws.exercise_tip: Practice the complete shooting motion without a ball, focusing on fluid movement.
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shot motion shows jerky movement (fluidity score: 13.0/100). Work on smoother, more rhythmic motion from start to finish.

feedback_points.user_value: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
feedback_points.remedy_tips: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.

feedback_points.user_value: Your shot timing could be more efficient. Work on smooth rhythm from catch to release.
feedback_points.remedy_tips: Focus on smooth rhythm from catch to release. Don't rush - let the shot flow naturally.

feedback_points.discrepancy: Guide Hand Under Ball: Guide hand positioned underneath ball instead of on side
feedback_points.user_value: Your guide hand is too far under the ball. Keep it on the side for proper support without interference.
feedback_points.remedy_tips: Position your guide hand on the side of the ball, not underneath. Think "passenger, not driver."

feedback_points.discrepancy: Poor Wrist Snap: Insufficient wrist snap on follow-through
feedback_points.user_value: Your wrist snap needs improvement. Snap your wrist down aggressively for better backspin and soft touch.
feedback_points.remedy_tips: Snap your wrist down aggressively after release. Your fingers should point to the floor.

feedback_points.discrepancy: Elbow extension at release (145.1°) is outside the ideal range (160-180°).

ideal_range.description: Ideal elbow extension at ball release for optimal arc and accuracy

feedback_points.remedy_tips: Focus on fully extending your elbow towards the basket. Imagine reaching into a cookie jar on a high shelf.
